intro: Malcolmia bungei var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth malcolmia, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are pale yellow and appear in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for dry garden environments.
